alert.note: Alert for Calabasas and Agoura Hills; Central Ventura County Valleys; Eastern San Fernando Valley; Eastern Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area; Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley; Northern Ventura County Mountains; Santa Clarita Valley; Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Southern Ventura County Mountains; Western San Fernando Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 30 at 9:48AM PDT until October 30 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 10 PM THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY SANTA ANA WINDS AND VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MUCH OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES... .The first strong Santa Ana wind event of the season is ongoing and expected to begin weakening today wind gusts of 35 to 55 mph through the mountains valleys and some coasts within the Santa Ana wind cooridor of LA/Ventura Counties with isolated gusts near 60 mph. Single digit humidities will prevail during the day with minimal recovery in the evening to overnight. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY SANTA ANA WINDS AND VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR VALLEYS OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES AS WELL AS THE VENTURA COUNTY MOUNTAINS AND EASTERN SANTA MONICAS... * Winds...North to northeast 25 to 40 mph with gusts 45 to 55 mph. * Relative Humidity...Minimum humidity each day 5 to 10 percent. Very poor humidity recoveries of 10 to 20 percent in wind prone areas. * Impacts...If fire ignition occurs there could be rapid spread of wildfire that would lead to a threat to life and property.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. Use extreme caution with anything that can spark a wildfire. Residents near wildland interfaces should be prepared to evacuate if a wildfire breaks out. See readyforwildfire.org and wildfirerisk.org for information.
